Package examblock.model

Class SessionList

Object
ListManager<Session>
SessionList
All Implemented Interfaces:
StreamManager
public class SessionList extends ListManager<Session>
A collection object for holding and managing Sessions.

    • getSessionNumber

      public int getSessionNumber(Venue venue, LocalDate day, LocalTime start)
      Find the sessionNumber of a session at a particular time in a given Venue. Return zero if no session exists at that time.
      Parameters:
      venue - - the venue object for the session we are looking for.
      day - the session date.
      start - the start time of the exam session.
      Returns:
      the sessionNumber of a session at a particular time in a given Venue, else zero.

    • getSession

      public Session getSession(Venue venue, int sessionNumber) throws IllegalStateException
      Get the Session with a matching Venue and sessionNumber.
      Parameters:
      venue - the Venue for which the session is to be found.
      sessionNumber - the sessionNumber of the Session you are looking for.
      Returns:
      The first Session with a matching Venue and sessionNumber, if it exists.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - throw an IllegalStateException if it can't find any such session as that indicates there is a potential misalignment of the executing state and the complete list of all items.

    • getSession

      public Session getSession(Venue venue, Exam exam) throws IllegalStateException
      Get the Session with a matching Venue and Exam scheduled.
      Parameters:
      venue - the Venue for which the session is to be found.
      exam - (one of) the exam(s) that has been allocated to this session in this venue.
      Returns:
      The first Session with a matching Venue and Exam, if it exists.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - throw an IllegalStateException if it can't find any such session as that indicates there is a potential misalignment of the executing state and the complete list of all items.

    • getSessionNewTotal

      public int getSessionNewTotal(Venue venue, Exam exam, int numberStudents)
      Find or create this session and work out how many students in total. Looks for an existing session or creates a new session (Venue and time) if not present in the session list; and then determines (from each of the exams in the session) what the total number of students will be in the session.

      If there is no existing session, prints: "There is currently no exam session in that venue at that time." and also prints: "Creating a session..." and creates a suitable session. When creating the new session, we first determine the next unique session number for this venue (suggest you may want to use a private helper method to do this). If this is the very first session created for this venue, uses session number 1. Session numbers do not have to be sequential, only unique. i.e. the first session may be in the middle of the week, the next at the end of the week and the next at the beginning - but the session numbers must still be unique, e.g. 3,6,1,7,5,2.

      For the session (existing/created), determines (from each of the exams in the session) what the total number of students will be in the session. IFF there are already other exams scheduled in the session (i.e. only if there are already students in the session), prints "There are already (whatever number already) students who will be taking an exam in that venue; along with the numberStudents students for this exam."

      Finally, prints "That's a total of (whatever the new total would be) students." and returns that total number of students that would be in the session if numberStudents were to be added (may be more than the venue can fit!).

      Parameters:
      venue - the exam venue for the session.
      exam - the exam to be allocated to this session in this venue.
      numberStudents - the number of students to be allocated to this session.
      Returns:
      The total number of students that will be in the session if numberStudents is added.

    • getExistingSessionTotal

      public int getExistingSessionTotal(Venue venue, Exam exam)
      Find this session and work out how many students in total. Unlike getSessionNewTotal(Venue, Exam, int), this method does not create a new session if one does not already exist, it just looks for an existing session. If there is no existing session, returns zero.
      Parameters:
      venue - where the session might be
      exam - the exam that might be scheduled in the session
      Returns:
      the total number of students in the session, or zero if there is no session.

    • scheduleExam

      public void scheduleExam(Venue venue, Exam exam)
      Allocates an exam to an existing session (Venue and time). Prints "(the title of the subject) exam added to the Identifier of the venue."

      Parameters:
      venue - the exam venue for the new session.
      exam - the exam to be allocated to this venue.

    • removeExam

      public void removeExam(Venue venue, Exam exam)
      Deallocates an exam from an existing session (Venue and time). Prints "(the title of the subject) exam removed from (the Identifier of the venue.)"

      Parameters:
      venue - the exam venue for the new session.
      exam - the exam to be allocated to this venue.

    • forVenue

      public List<Session> forVenue(Venue venue)
      Creates a new list holding references to those Sessions for a given Venue in this SessionList.
      Parameters:
      venue - the exam venue for the list of items.
      Returns:
      A new list holding references to all the items in this sessionList.
